Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on Varicose Vein Management Guidelines

Participants.evidence: The study focused on patients with lower extremity varicose veins (CEAP Class C2 disease).

Intervention.evidence: The guidelines addressed prevention and management strategies, including compression, medications, and nutritional supplements, as well as treatment of varicose tributaries and management of complications.

Objective.evidence: To provide updated, evidence-based guidelines for the management of varicose veins.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the development of comprehensive guidelines for varicose vein management, measured over the study period.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The guidelines provided strong and weak recommendations, ungraded consensus statements, and good practice statements.
